intro: Antirrhinum leiocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from red to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy, bilaterally symmetric blooms. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, which contributes to its common name. Antirrhinum leiocalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
